channel.title: [PI] Error: T1 - 174,5
channel.description:
Hello,
I am using the server: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,664646.0.html
My problem is with packet 174. When i attack any npc a T1 Error output is written in the client CMD, which i searched EVRYWHERE for a fix for it..
I only found out that it has something to do with the packet 174 being used in the wrong place since it's a music packet ( correct me if i'm wrong ).
GIF for explanation:
[spoiler][img]http://i.gyazo.com/ac235bf27e119cca72d99e6ddb7aaaaf.gif[/img][/spoiler]
I'd really appreciate anybody helping me out please.
:)

item.title: [PI] Error: T1 - 174,5
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:11, topic:548977”]"It’s not used"
A lot of people remove it because they don’t use any of the sounds or etc.

Tbh if you don’t, you can just leave these:

                                int i4 = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
                                int l11 = inStream.readUnsignedByte();
                                int k17 = inStream.readUnsignedWord();

So you don’t get the errors… (You don’t even need the int part, just the inStream.read…)[/quote]

Yeah i won’t be using it for now too. Thank you again

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Error: T1 - 174,5
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

"It’s not used"
A lot of people remove it because they don’t use any of the sounds or etc.

Tbh if you don’t, you can just leave these:

                                int i4 = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
                                int l11 = inStream.readUnsignedByte();
                                int k17 = inStream.readUnsignedWord();

So you don’t get the errors… (You don’t even need the int part, just the inStream.read…)

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Error: T1 - 174,5
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:548977”]There should be data underneath that case statement…

Like mine has this:

case 174: int i4 = inStream.readUnsignedWord(); int l11 = inStream.readUnsignedByte(); int k17 = inStream.readUnsignedWord(); if (aBoolean848 && !lowMem && anInt1062 < 50) { anIntArray1207[anInt1062] = i4; anIntArray1241[anInt1062] = l11; anIntArray1250[anInt1062] = k17 + Sounds.anIntArray326[i4]; anInt1062++; } pktType = -1; return true;[/quote]

I added the code and it no longer displays the T1 error, Not even when picking up items!

Thank you so much!

Why would it be removed in the first place?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Error: T1 - 174,5
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

There should be data underneath that case statement…

Like mine has this:

case 174: int i4 = inStream.readUnsignedWord(); int l11 = inStream.readUnsignedByte(); int k17 = inStream.readUnsignedWord(); if (aBoolean848 && !lowMem && anInt1062 < 50) { anIntArray1207[anInt1062] = i4; anIntArray1241[anInt1062] = l11; anIntArray1250[anInt1062] = k17 + Sounds.anIntArray326[i4]; anInt1062++; } pktType = -1; return true;

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Error: T1 - 174,5
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:548977”]yes that would be your issue.

createFrame(174) is sending frame (packet) 174.

What does your client sided data for packet 174 look like?[/quote]

Literally nothing, it was commented out since i got it.

Is that what you mean?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Error: T1 - 174,5
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

yes that would be your issue.

createFrame(174) is sending frame (packet) 174.

What does your client sided data for packet 174 look like?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Error: T1 - 174,5
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Remove it server sided.

Remove what?

edit: Is this what’s causing all this?

public void resetFollow() { c.followId = 0; c.followId2 = 0; c.mageFollow = false; c.outStream.createFrame(174); c.outStream.writeWord(0); c.outStream.writeByte(0); c.outStream.writeWord(1); }

That the packet 174 is used for following?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Error: T1 - 174,5
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Remove it server sided.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

I think i got it.

EDIT: nvm , crashed my client. i have no idea what i’m doing at this point.

It also happens when i click on an item on the ground…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Error: T1 - 174,5
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

Packet 174 is actually a music packet. I’ll upload the data to rswiki.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Error: T1 - 174,5
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

https://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=317_Protocol
I don’t see any music packets on the wiki with an ID of 174… But not every packet is on there (there’s only a few not).

Also.
T1 = Unknown packet.
T2 = Packet error.
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/114399-client-errors-what-numbers-mean.html

Read full topic
